IntroGnome
public class Gnome extends Bubble
Gnome Sort, also known as Stupid Sort, is a simple sorting algorithm that works by repeatedly comparing adjacent elements and swapping them if they are in the wrong order. It gets its name from the way it "stumbles" through the list, similar to a gnome moving around.
Since:
1.0

  • Constructor Details

    • Gnome

      public Gnome()
      Gnome Sort:
      Also known as Stupid Sort, is a simple sorting algorithm that works by repeatedly comparing adjacent elements and swapping them if they are in the wrong order. It gets its name from the way it "stumbles" through the list, similar to a gnome moving around.

      Example:
      1. Start with an unsorted array of elements.
      2. Set the current position (pos) to 0.
      3. While pos is less than the length of the array:
        • If pos is 0 or the current element is in the correct order with the previous element, move to the next position by incrementing pos.
        • If the current element is out of order with the previous element, swap them and move one position back by decrementing pos.
      4. Repeat step 3 until pos reaches the end of the array.
      5. The array is now sorted.
      Note:
      Gnome Sort iteratively moves through the array, comparing adjacent elements and swapping them if necessary. If a swap occurs, it moves one position back to recheck the element with the previous one. This process continues until the entire array is sorted.

      Gnome Sort has a time complexity of O(n^2) in the average and worst cases, where n is the number of elements in the array. It is not considered an efficient sorting algorithm for large datasets due to its quadratic time complexity. However, it is relatively easy to understand and implement.

      Property:
      Worst Case Complexity: O(n^2)
      Best Case Complexity: O(n)
      Average Case Complexity: O(n^2)
      Auxiliary Space: O(1)
      Stability: No
      See Also:
      • IntroDPQGnome
      • IntroGnome

    • gnomeInc

      protected void gnomeInc(Comparable[] array)
      gnomeInc that implements the Gnome Sort algorithm to sort an array of Comparable objects in ascending order.
      • The @SuppressWarnings("unchecked") annotation is used to suppress compiler warnings related to type safety when using the compareTo method.
      • Start with an unsorted array of elements.
      • Set the current position (pos) to 0.
      • While pos is less than the length of the array:
        • If pos is 0 or the current element is in the correct order with the previous element, move to the next position by incrementing pos.
        • If the current element is out of order with the previous element, swap them and move one position back by decrementing pos.
      • Repeat step 3 until pos reaches the end of the array.
      gnomeInc method implements the Gnome Sort algorithm to sort the given array of Comparable objects in ascending order.
      Parameters:
      array - to be arranged.
      See Also:
      • SortSwap.swap(Comparable[], int, int)

    • gnomeInc

      protected void gnomeInc(Comparable[] array, int left, int right)
      gnomeInc that implements the Gnome Sort algorithm to sort an array of Comparable objects in ascending order.
      • The @SuppressWarnings("unchecked") annotation is used to suppress compiler warnings related to type safety when using the compareTo method.
      • Start with an unsorted array of elements.
      • Set the current position (pos) to 0.
      • While pos is less than the length of the array:
        • If pos is 0 or the current element is in the correct order with the previous element, move to the next position by incrementing pos.
        • If the current element is out of order with the previous element, swap them and move one position back by decrementing pos.
      • Repeat step 3 until pos reaches the end of the array.
      gnomeInc method implements the Gnome Sort algorithm to sort the given array of Comparable objects in ascending order.
      Parameters:
      array - to be arranged.
      left - the value in the array must be smaller than a right parameter.
      right - the value in the array must be greater than a left parameter.
      See Also:
